result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony L Fox was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Counseling deemed necessary.

No contact with victim (BEL), her family or residence.

Submit to DNA sample.
READ-INS: See Statement of Uncharged Read-Ins

records.addlTxt:
11:52 Defendant Anthony L Fox in court with attorney William Michael Lennon.  Defendant Anthony L Fox in custody.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Grode files Statement of Uncharged Read-Ins. 
Attorney Grode mades statement and recommends 12 years ITC and 12 years ES.
Attorney Lennon makes statement and recommends 3-5 years ITC and ES.
Victim makes statement.
Sentencing hearing on April 20, 2015 at 11:30 am.

11:20 Defendant Anthony L Fox in court with attorney William Michael Lennon.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Lennon is requesting an alternative PSI. He indicates the report can be done within 4 weeks. State is opposed to adjournment. Victim's parents make statement.
Court grants request for adjournment so alternative PSI can be done. Court, however, revokes bond and defendant is remanded to the Wood County Jail.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 8:34 Defendant Anthony L Fox in court with attorney William M. Lennon.  Derek Dominguez appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders Pre-Sentence Investigation. State requests that bond be revoked. Attorney Lennon argues that bond should continue. Court will continue bond, but adds condition of may not leave State of Wisconsin.
Invoice for NGI Evaluation

9:02 Defendant Anthony L Fox in court with attorney William M. Lennon.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Lennon states that defendant withdraws his NGI plea and reinstates not guilty plea. Bond is continued.
Jury trial - 12 person on December 17, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on October 31, 2014 at 09:00 am.
regarding NGI plea - SEALED BY THE COURT

8:43 Attorney William M. Lennon in court.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Doctor's report came in late on Friday and Attorney Lennon has not had a chance to read it or discuss it with defendant.
Court will remove trial date from calendar on October 1 and use time as a status conference.
Hearing on September 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
for Examination under 971.16
cover letter from Attorney Lennon regarding Order for Examination
Jury trial - 12 person on October 1, 2014 at 08:15 am.

9:40 Defendant Anthony L Fox in court with attorney William M. Lennon.  Defendant Anthony L Fox in custody.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing and enters plea of not guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. Bond is continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 12, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on July 30, 2014 at 09:30 am.
No contact with B.E.L. or residence and no contact with anyone under 18 except biological children and absolute sobriety.
No contact w/ BEL or residence.  No contact with minor children.   Absolute sobriety.
Defendant Anthony L Fox in court with attorney David R. Dickmann.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bound over.
